intro: Aristea flexicaulis, commonly known as the flexible aristea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features slender, wiry stems and small, pale blue or white florets that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aristea flexicaulis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
